definition: rare/uncommon/rarity/to value as a rarity/to cherish/Taiwan pr. [xi1 han3]

sentences.english: This nautical miles of the object is really strange, what are rare.
sentences.chinese: 這海里的物件，真是千奇百怪，什麼稀罕物都有。

sentences.english: Do you know how rare that is?
Several rare birds have been sighted in this area.
sentences.chinese: 有人曾在這一地區看見幾種稀罕的珍禽。

sentences.english: Liang Jan noticed that Gu Gang had more rare breeds than he had.
sentences.chinese: 粱江注意到顧剛比他擁有更多的稀罕品種。

sentences.english: A cart pulled by oxen is now a curiosity.
sentences.chinese: 用牛拉的車現在已成了稀罕物。

sentences.english: Film costume rarely gets better than this.
sentences.chinese: 電影戲服中很少有比這更稀罕的了。

sentences.english: Together, also what paradises it cherish, what hells does it fear?
sentences.chinese: 我們在一起，還稀罕什麼天堂，還懼怕什麼地獄？

sentences.english: It is not a rare thing in China that the people participates the management of country affairs.
sentences.chinese: 老百姓參政議政在中國已經不再是稀罕的事情了。

sentences.english: I'll never forget finding that rare old coin in my garden.
sentences.chinese: 我永遠不會忘記在我花園裏找到的那枚稀罕的古幣。

sentences.english: Its unusual colour is shared by only a handful of other plants.
sentences.chinese: 它非同凡響的色彩在其他植物中是非常稀罕的。

sentences.english: Carefully manage your time. It's your scarcest and least renewable resource.
sentences.chinese: 妥善利用時間，時間是最稀罕的及不可能再得的資源。

sentences.english: Such apparent paradoxes are far from uncommon.
sentences.chinese: 這樣明顯的悖論並不稀罕。

sentences.english: Telephones and TV sets were rarities.
sentences.chinese: 電話和電視機是稀罕東西。

sentences.english: Less contact will become weak feelings, I do not care.
sentences.chinese: 少了聯繫就變淡的感情，我不稀罕。

definition: erhua variant of 玩意[wan2 yi4]
toy/plaything/thing/act/trick (in a performance, stage show, acrobatics etc)
variant of 玩意兒|玩意儿[wan2 yi4 r5]
best quality/item of the highest quality/(slang) outrageous/annoying in the extreme/gross/person with these qualities
to think of/to keep thinking about/to be concerned about
